comments:
I20040529 Mac OS X

I got an entry in the error log and when I try to look at the details by double clicking on the entry I get 
the following NPE.  Note that despite the NPE the dialog does come up and I am able to look at the 
contents.

Nowhere in the stack is a reference to a PDE class.  Moving back to Platform 
UI.
Looks like it may have to do with the editors.
was this a repeatable case for you veronika?

Once I got into the state where this happened it was very repeatable.  
However, then I restarted eclipse and it stopped happening.  I am not sure of 
the exact steps to get into this state but I have seen it in various forms 
(not just double clicking on the Error Log).  I have seen it quite often on 
the mac - not yet on any other platform but I have seen bug reports for NPE in 
WorkbenchWindow$5.shellActivated on Windows from somebody else.

I have been going to the Preference dialog quite often in the last couple of 
days - not sure if that has something to do with it.  Also, I have been 
docking my perspective switcher on the left.

I can holler for you the next time it happens if you like.

Tracking back to the correct version of WorkbenchWindow, the offending line 
appears to be "site.getPane().shellActivated()".  This is now line 1917. 
 
It does not seem possible for the site to the have a null pane.  So, the only 
thought is that the site itself is null.  According to the doc, this should 
only happen if the editor part is not yet initialized.

A lot of this code has changed and it does not appear to be repeatable.  I'm
going to close this, please re-open if you see it again.
